title: Examples
text: document demonstrates functionalities drmr R package fitting Dynamic Range Species Distribution Models (DRMs SDMs, respectively) using pre-compiled Stan models. ’ll explore increasingly complex models, showcasing package’s capabilities help five additional R packages: sf: spatial data manipulation visualization ggplot2: creating graphs bayesplot: visualizing MCMC outputs dplyr: data wrangling skimr: quick descriptive statistics

title: Examples
text: drmr package provides pre-compiled cmdstanr [@gabry2024cmdstanr] models powered instantiate package [@landau2024instantiate]. pre-compiled models allow us make inferences DRM (SDM) using cmdstan algorithms, HMC NUTS Sampler. package CRAN yet. install version hosted GitHub, run: Finally, code loads packages necessary reproduce examples document.
code: remotes::install_github("pinskylab/drmr") library(drmr) library(sf) ## "mapping" library(ggplot2) ## graphs library(bayesplot) ## and more graphs library(dplyr)

title: Examples
text: example uses Summer Flounder data Alexa’s project. begin loading dataset calculating density variable (raw counts divided patch area): quick exploration data @tbl-summary reveals following: Surface salinity (ssalin) bottom salinity (bsalin) missing values (around 30% missing ). least 25% density (dens) values zero. Finally, split data, reserving last five years evaluating predictions:
code: ## loads the data data(sum_fl)  ## computing density sum_fl <- sum_fl |>   mutate(dens = y / area_km2,          .before = y) ## Density is being multiplied by 10000 because the non-negative densities are ## too small skimr::skim_without_charts(mutate(sum_fl, dens = 10000 * dens)) ## 5 years-ahead predictions first_year_forecast <- max(sum_fl$year) - 5  first_id_forecast <-   first_year_forecast - min(sum_fl$year) + 1  ## splitting data dat_test <- sum_fl |>   filter(year >= first_year_forecast)  dat_train <- sum_fl |>   filter(year < first_year_forecast)

code: sdm_compiled <-   instantiate::stan_package_model(name = "sdm",                                   package = "drmr") drm_compiled <-   instantiate::stan_package_model(name = "drm",                                   package = "drmr") forecast_sdm <-   instantiate::stan_package_model(name = "forecast_sdm",                                   package = "drmr")  forecast_drm <-   instantiate::stan_package_model(name = "forecast",                                   package = "drmr") centroids_compiled <-   instantiate::stan_package_model(name = "centroid",                                   package = "drmr")

title: Examples
text: Currently, addition pre-compiled models, drmr package three functions. following: make_data: creates list used input drm model (see ?drmr::make_data function arguments). default_priors function takes arguments return default hyperparameters priors model; default_toggles another function taking arguments. one return default “toggles” drm model. toggles turn features model (e.g., movement) . Let us start fitting simplest DRM available package. first step, always use make_data function create input cmdstan model. function takes set inputs, turn appropriate format code. , provide three inputs function: y vector densities time vector time points site vector patches/sites. output names(data) displays “names” elements output list make_data. elements inferred y, time, site others take default values. example: n_ages total number (unobserved) ages AA. provided, n_ages taken 1. f represents fa,tf_{, t} @eq-surv. default value fa,t=0f_{, t} = 0 every age time point. m mortality rate mm @eq-surv. default value 0.25 1. code: data <-   make_data(y = dat_train$dens, ## response variable: density             time = dat_train$year, ## vector of time points             site = dat_train$patch, ## vector of patches             n_ages = 8, ## number of age groups             .toggles = list(likelihood = 1))  ## checking the elements of the list: class(data) names(data) drm_1 <- drm_compiled$sample(data = data,                              iter_sampling = 400, ## number of samples after warmup                              iter_warmup = 400, ## number of warmup samples                              seed = 2025,                              chains = 4,                              parallel_chains = 4) data <-   make_data(y = dat_train$dens, ## response variable: density             time = dat_train$year, ## vector of time points             site = dat_train$patch, ## vector of patches             n_ages = 8, ## number of age groups             .toggles = list(likelihood = 1, time_ar = 1))  drm_2 <- drm_compiled$sample(data = data,                              iter_sampling = 400, ## number of samples after                                                   ## warmup                              iter_warmup = 400, ## number of warmup samples                              seed = 2025,                              chains = 4,                              parallel_chains = 4) fmat <-   system.file("fmat.rds", package = "drmr") |>   readRDS()  years_all <- seq_len(NCOL(fmat)) years_train <- years_all[years_all < first_id_forecast] years_test  <- years_all[years_all >= first_id_forecast]  f_train <- fmat[, years_train] f_test  <- fmat[, years_test] data <-   make_data(y = dat_train$dens, ## response variable: density             time = dat_train$year, ## vector of time points             site = dat_train$patch, ## vector of patches             f_mort = f_train,             n_ages = NROW(f_train), ## number of age groups             .toggles = list(likelihood = 1, time_ar = 1))  drm_3 <- drm_compiled$sample(data = data,                              iter_sampling = 400, ## number of samples after                                                   ## warmup                              iter_warmup = 400,   ## number of warmup samples                              seed = 2025,                              chains = 4,                              parallel_chains = 4) map_name <- system.file("maps/sum_fl.shp", package = "drmr")  polygons <- st_read(map_name)  ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = polygons,           color = 1,           fill = "gray70") +   theme_bw() adj_mat <- gen_adj(st_buffer(st_geometry(polygons),                              dist = 2500))  ## row-standardized matrix adj_mat <-   t(apply(adj_mat, 1, \(x) x / (sum(x)))) data <-   make_data(y = dat_train$dens, ## response variable: density             time = dat_train$year, ## vector of time points             site = dat_train$patch, ## vector of patches             f_mort = f_train,             n_ages = NROW(f_train), ## number of age groups             adj_mat = adj_mat,             age_at_maturity = 3, ## age at which fish are able to move             .toggles = list(likelihood = 1, ## non-zero density pdf                             time_ar = 1, ## ar(1) for recruitment                             movement = 1)) ## turning movement on  drm_4 <- drm_compiled$sample(data = data,                              iter_sampling = 400, ## number of samples after                                                   ## warmup                              iter_warmup = 400,   ## number of warmup samples                              seed = 2025,                              chains = 4,                              parallel_chains = 4) avgs <- c("stemp" = mean(dat_train$stemp),           "btemp" = mean(dat_train$btemp))  min_year <- dat_train$year |> min()  dat_train <- dat_train |>   mutate(stemp = stemp - avgs["stemp"],          btemp = btemp - avgs["btemp"],          time  = year - min_year)  dat_test <- dat_test |>   mutate(stemp = stemp - avgs["stemp"],          btemp = btemp - avgs["btemp"],          time  = year - min_year) ##--- formulas (will be helpful for forecasting as well) ----  ## formula for the linear predictor of recruitmemt it defines a quadratic ## relationship between recruitment and surface temperature form_r <- ~ 1 +   stemp +   I(stemp * stemp)  ## formula for the linear predictor in the survival rates form_m <- ~ 1 + btemp + I(btemp * btemp)  ## formula for the linear predictor of observing a zero density form_t <- ~ 1 +   btemp +   I(btemp * btemp) +   stemp +   I(stemp * stemp) +   I(btemp * stemp)  ##--- building "X matrices" ----  x_m <- model.matrix(form_m,                     data = dat_train) x_r <- model.matrix(form_r,                     data = dat_train) x_t <- model.matrix(form_t,                     data = dat_train) data <-   make_data(y = dat_train$dens, ## response variable: density             time = dat_train$year, ## vector of time points             site = dat_train$patch, ## vector of patches             f_mort = f_train,             n_ages = NROW(f_train), ## number of age groups             x_t = x_t,             x_r = x_r,             x_m = x_m,             adj_mat = adj_mat,             age_at_maturity = 3, ## age at which fish are able to move             .toggles = list(likelihood = 1, ## non-zero density pdf                             time_ar = 1, ## ar(1) for recruitment                             qr_t = 1, ## QR parametrization for mortality coefs                             est_mort = 1, ## turn env dependent mortality on                             movement = 1), ## turning movement on             .priors = list(pr_phi_a = 9, ## hyperpar for phi prior (phi ~ Gamma(a, b))                            pr_phi_b = .5, ## hyperpar for phi prior                            pr_coef_r_mu = rep(0, ncol(x_r)), ## hyperpar for coef_r                            pr_coef_r_sd = c(10000, rep(1, ncol(x_r) - 1)))) ## hyperpar for coef_r ## initial values for mcmc init_5 <-    drm_compiled$pathfinder(data = data,                           seed = 2025,                           num_paths = 4,                           save_single_paths = TRUE,                           psis_resample = FALSE)   drm_5 <- drm_compiled$sample(data = data,                              iter_sampling = 400, ## number of samples after                                                   ## warmup                              iter_warmup = 400,   ## number of warmup samples                              seed = 2025,                              chains = 4,                              init = init_5,                              parallel_chains = 4) ## title: Get Started
text: assess model predictions, chunk splits data train test. Finally, transform response variable density.
code: ## 5 years-ahead predictions first_year_forecast <- max(sum_fl$year) - 5  first_id_forecast <-   first_year_forecast - min(sum_fl$year) + 1  years_all <- length(unique(sum_fl$year)) years_train <- years_all[years_all < first_id_forecast] years_test <- years_all[years_all >= first_id_forecast]  ## splitting data dat_test <- sum_fl |>   filter(year >= first_year_forecast)  dat_train <- sum_fl |>   filter(year < first_year_forecast) dat_train <- dat_train |>   mutate(dens = y / area_km2,          .before = y)  dat_test <- dat_test |>   mutate(dens = y / area_km2,          .before = y)

title: Theoretical Background
text: Define sa,t,=exp{mi,t−fa,t}, s_{, t, } = \exp \{ m_{, t} - f_{, t} \}, environment dependent survival age aa time tt site ii. , scenario without movement, expected density age aa time tt site ii can written : λa,t,=exp{ψt,+zt(r)∏k=1a−1sk,t,}=exp{ψt,+zt(r)}exp{(−1)mt,−∑k=1a−1fa,t}. \begin{align} \lambda_{, t, } & = \exp \{ \psi_{t, } + z_{t}^{(r)} \prod_{k = 1}^{- 1} s_{k, t, } \} \\ & = \exp \{ \psi_{t, } + z_{t}^{(r)} \} \exp \left \{ (- 1) m_{t, }- \sum_{k = 1}^{- 1} f_{, t} \right \}. \end{align} Therefore, closed form expected density μi,t\mu_{, t} : μt,=∑=1Aλa,t,=exp{ψt,+zt(r)}(1+∑=2Aexp{(−1)mt,−∑k=1a−1fk,t}). \begin{align} \mu_{t, } & = \sum_{= 1}^{} \lambda_{, t, } \\ & = \exp \{ \psi_{t, } + z_{t}^{(r)} \} \left (1 + \sum_{= 2}^{} \exp \left \{ (- 1) m_{t, } - \sum_{k = 1}^{- 1} f_{k, t} \right \} \right ). \end{align} , selectivity, μt,=∑=1Avaλa,t,=exp{ψt,+zt(r)}(v1+∑=2Avaexp{(−1)mt,−∑k=1a−1fk,t}). \begin{align} \mu_{t, } & = \sum_{= 1}^{} v_a \lambda_{, t, } \\ & = \exp \{ \psi_{t, } + z_{t}^{(r)} \} \left (v_1 + \sum_{= 2}^{} v_a \exp \left \{ (- 1) m_{t, } - \sum_{k = 1}^{- 1} f_{k, t} \right \} \right ). \end{align}

title: Fit the dynamic range model. — fit_drm
code: fit_drm(   .data,   y_col,   time_col,   site_col,   family = "lognormal1",   formula_zero = ~1,   formula_rec = ~1,   formula_surv = NULL,   iter_warmup = 1000,   iter_sampling = 1000,   chains = 4,   parallel_chains = 4,   seed,   init = "cmdstan_default",   ... )

title: Fit the dynamic range model. — fit_drm
text: .data data frame containing data model. y_col character specifying name column .data contains response variable. time_col character specifying name column .data contains time variable. site_col character specifying name column .data contains site variable. family character specifying family probability distribution assumed density. options : "lognormal1" (default): log-normal usual parametrization; "lognormal2": log-normal parametrized terms mean; "gamma": gamma parametrized terms mean; "loglogistic": log-logistic parametrized terms mean. formula_zero formula specifying model zero inflation component. Defaults ~ 1 (intercept ). formula_rec formula specifying model recruitment component. Defaults ~ 1 (intercept ). formula_surv formula specifying model survival component. NULL (default), survival component included. iter_warmup integer specifying number warmup iterations MCMC sampler. Defaults 1000. iter_sampling integer specifying number sampling iterations MCMC sampler. Defaults 1000. chains integer specifying number MCMC chains. Defaults 4. parallel_chains integer specifying number chains run parallel. Defaults 4. seed integer specifying random number seed. init character specifying initialization method.  Can "cmdstan_default" (default), "prior" (initialize model parameters using samples prior) "pathfinder". ... Passed make_data() function used build input list cmdstanr model.

title: Fit the dynamic range model. — fit_drm
text: list containing MCMC draws model data. Specifically: draws: MCMC draws fitted model. data: data used fit model (list).

what: Fit a GLM based SDM — fit_sdm
title: Fit a GLM based SDM — fit_sdm
text: Fit SDM Stan model (function stable yet fully tested).

title: Fit a GLM based SDM — fit_sdm
code: fit_sdm(   .data,   y_col,   time_col,   site_col,   family = "lognormal1",   formula_zero = ~1,   formula_dens = ~1,   iter_warmup = 1000,   iter_sampling = 1000,   chains = 4,   parallel_chains = 4,   seed,   init = "cmdstan_default",   ... )

title: Fit a GLM based SDM — fit_sdm
text: .data data frame containing data model. y_col character specifying name column .data contains response variable. time_col character specifying name column .data contains time variable. site_col character specifying name column .data contains site variable. family character specifying family probability distribution assumed density. options : "lognormal1" (default): log-normal usual parametrization; "lognormal2": log-normal parametrized terms mean; "gamma": gamma parametrized terms mean; "loglogistic": log-logistic parametrized terms mean. formula_zero formula specifying model zero inflation component. Defaults ~ 1 (intercept ). formula_dens formula specifying model non-zero density component. Defaults ~ 1 (intercept ). iter_warmup integer specifying number warmup iterations MCMC sampler. Defaults 1000. iter_sampling integer specifying number sampling iterations MCMC sampler. Defaults 1000. chains integer specifying number MCMC chains. Defaults 4. parallel_chains integer specifying number chains run parallel. Defaults 4. seed integer specifying random number seed. init character specifying initialization method.  Can "cmdstan_default" (default) "pathfinder". ... Passed make_data() function used build input list cmdstanr model.

title: Fit a GLM based SDM — fit_sdm
text: list containing MCMC draws model data. draws: MCMC draws fitted model. data: data used fit model (list).

title: Fit a GLM based SDM — fit_sdm
text: lcgodoy

text: function creates list used input stan model.

title: Make data for DRM stan models — make_data
code: make_data(   y,   time,   site,   f_mort,   m = 0.25,   x_t,   x_m,   x_r,   n_ages = 1,   age_selectivity,   age_at_maturity,   adj_mat = matrix(0, ncol = 1, nrow = 1),   .toggles,   .priors,   family = "lognormal1",   reorder = TRUE )

title: Make data for DRM stan models — make_data
text: y numeric vector species' densities. time vector indicating time point associated element y. site vector indicating sites associated element y. f_mort optional matrix informing instantaneous fishing mortality rates age (columns) timepoint (rows). m numeric value corresponding instantaneous natural mortality rate. x_t design matrix variables associated probability absence site/time. x_m design matrix variables associated survival. x_r design matrix variables associated recruitment. n_ages integer indicating number ages underlying population dynamic model. age_selectivity numeric vector n_ages elements, element indicates selectivity respective age. elements vector must lie 0 1. age_at_maturity integer indicating age species attains maturity. used movement. , every individual age greater equal age_at_maturity may move one patch another. Individuals age threshold remain "static". adj_mat adjacency matrix dimensions sites \(\times\) sites. elements 1 two sites neighbors zero otherwise. .toggles list toggles model components. components : cloglog: 1 use complementary log-log 0 logit link function absence probabilities. movement: 1 allow (adjacent) moviment; 0 static. est_mort: 1 estimate mortality 0 otherwise. time_ar: 1 incorporate AR(1) process recruitment. qr_t: 1 use QR parametrization absence probability regression coefficients 0 otherwise. qr_r: 1 use QR parametrization recruitment regression coefficients 0 otherwise. qr_m: 1 use QR parametrization survival regression coefficients 0 otherwise. .priors list priors hyperparameters. family character specifying family probability distribution assumed density. options : "lognormal1" (default): log-normal usual parametrization; "lognormal2": log-normal parametrized terms mean; "gamma": gamma parametrized terms mean; "loglogistic": log-logistic parametrized terms mean. reorder boolean telling whether data needs reordered. default TRUE means data points ordered site time, respectively.

title: Make data for DRM stan models — make_data
text: list used input stan model

title: Make data for DRM stan models — make_data
text: lcgodoy

text: drm CmdStanFit object containing samples posterior distribution. drm_data list used input model fitting. Typically, output make_data function. ntime_for integer denoting number timepoints forecast. x_tt design matrix variables associated probability absence site/time. x_rt design matrix variables associated recruitment. x_mt design matrix variables associated survival. x_mpast design matrix variables associated survival last year "training" perior (.e., period using fit model obtain parameters' estimates). f_test matrix informing instantaneous fishing mortality rates age (columns) timepoint (rows). seed seed used forecasts. title: drmr 0.0.1
text: First version package containing pre-compiled code fitting DRM, making forecasts calculating density weighted centroids.

title: drmr 0.0.2
text: Parameters code documentation properly matched. p_error toggle becomes time_ar toggle (appropriate). predict_drm function created make_data function now family argument indicating probability distribution assumed response (given model parameters latent variables)

title: drmr 0.0.21
text: make_data_sdm function (analogous make_data) created SDM. predict_sdm function (analogous predict_drm) created SDM.

title: drmr 0.0.22
text: fit_drm fit_sdm functions make model fitting slightly simpler. pr_phi_a pr_phi_b become pr_phi_mu pr_phi_sd. prior log(ϕ)\log(\phi) Student’s t 3 degrees freedom, mean pr_phi_mu SD pr_phi_sd. Selectivity make_data fixed, thanks Mark. , used users input .

title: drmr 0.0.23
text: prior α\alpha modified. particular, instead pcp prior, now put Beta prior (α+1)/2(\alpha + 1) / 2. hyperparameters Beta distribution pr_alpha_a pr_alpha_b, respectively. New functions initialize parameters prior introduced. Now init parmeter fit_sdm fit_drm functions can take three possible values: “default”: standard initialization Stan (details see Stan's   documentation). “prior”: initialize parameters using samples respective prior distributions; “pathfinder”: uses Pathfinder algorithm initialize parameters. Fixed issues documentation.

title: drmr 0.0.24
text: Initial values population dynamics fixed.
